snippet: Political campaigns don’t know anything more about your online behavior than any retailer, news outlet or savvy blogger.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Ethan Roeder, data director of Obama for America, dispels common misconceptions about data-driven political campaigns; contends that by harnessing available digital data, political campaigns are moving toward treating each voter as individual, rather than as members of meaningless groups.
lead_paragraph: Political campaigns don’t know anything more about your online behavior than any retailer, news outlet or savvy blogger.
